channel.title: Simple 3D-model request
channel.description: I need simple models of all the super mario bros entities (including mario, luigi, goombas, and all that). I want them to be very pixelated, so it's probably not too hard to make. Basically they should have the same resolution as the super mario bros 1 for nes characters. They can probably be built entirely using quads with no trouble at all for most people, however i am clueless when it comes to 3d modelling so if some kind soul is interested in doing this i'd be very grateful, thank you.

item.title: Simple 3D-model request
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:13, topic:334765”]if you cant generate models that simple given a bitmap sprite, you smell[/quote]Actually i never thought about doing that, good idea!

item.title: Simple 3D-model request
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Wow spel you really don’t know anything. You can’t animate something like that, and OBJ is a simple format that only supports vertex coords, no textures or animation.

If i made one of those for every frame that would take a while, but i think theres only 2 walking frames, stand still, and a jumping frame. What are you going for in this, like a sort of corner view game boy game? Or like a paper mario pixel version?

Read full topic

item.title: Simple 3D-model request
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:7, topic:334765”]lol im going to shoot the literal gun here:

like that but flat?[/quote]Actually that is fuckin perfect! i wanted it have a little thickness anyway, so that’s awesome! Does obj format support animations? (i am pretty much new to 3d programming overall), if so it would be great to have the frames for different “animations”.

Read full topic

item.title: Simple 3D-model request
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

Frell:

Im getting a little thrown off here, instead of saying pixelated could you just say the max polygon count that you can support?

Exactly like original smb. I can scale them as required in opengl later, but i want them to actually look “pixelated” for the nostalgic feeling. Polycount should be pretty low that way as well.

Just make them like 1 “cube” on the z-index, so essentially they are still flat

Read full topic

item.title: Simple 3D-model request
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:

item.title: Simple 3D-model request
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:2, topic:334765”]Textured?[/quote]Yes thanks, preferrably in .obj format

[quote=“Unhandled, post:3, topic:334765”]lol @ “pixelated” models being easier to make…[/quote]Shouldn’t it be? I’d think all you do is combine a bunch of cubes in a 3d modelling application.

Read full topic
